doc: A new bond is added only when the distance between two atoms is below the sum of their v.d.W. radii minus the tolerance (as percentage). Values between 0.0 and 1.0 should be used. If the given string is parsable to a double, then it is used as the value. Otherwise, the string is interpreted as an expression defining the value (e.g., '${sin(0.2)}' would be evaluated to the value of the sine of 0.2).

Additional contribution to the tolerance value of atoms in 1-3 relation (i.e., when evaluating the distance r_AC in A-B-C). If the given string is parsable to a double, then it is used as the value. Otherwise, the string is interpreted as an expression defining the value (e.g., '${sin(0.2)}' would be evaluated to the value of the sine of 0.2).
Elemental symbol of atoms to which bonds have to be added.
Pathname to an SDF file defining a connectivity table that should be imposed in the input chemical system to generate the output (All tolerances are ignores).

Pathname to an SDF file defining a connectivity table that should be used as reference for bond lengths. Prints a warning if the bond lengths in the input chemical system differ from the value in the reference geometry by more than the tolerance.

tag: the importing of chemical objects (e.g., molecular geometries)
